bioghist.p: Virginia Lee Burton (1909-1968) was an illustrator and author of children's books. Burton's books include Mike Mulligan and His Steam Shovel, Katy and the Big Snow, Choo Choo, Calico the Wonder Horse, Life Story, and The Little House, which won the Caldecott Medal in 1942. Burton lived with her two sons, Aristides and Michael, and her husband George Demetrios, the sculptor, in a section of Gloucester, Massachusetts, called Folly Cove. Here she taught a class in design and from it emerged the Folly Cove Designers, a group of internationally known professional artisans. The last act in her book, Life Story, tells the story of her life in Folly Cove.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of text with captions, separations, sketches and drawings, galley proofs, dummies, finished jacket drawings, and sketchbooks for Burton's book Life Story.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
